case_vignette: A 25-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department after being involved in a rear-end collision, in which she was the restrained driver of the back car. On arrival, she is alert and active. She reports pain in both knees and severe pain over the right groin. Temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 116/min, respirations are 19/min, and blood pressure is 132/79 mm Hg. Physical examination shows tenderness over both knee caps. The right groin is tender to palpation. The right leg is slightly shortened, flexed, adducted, and internally rotated. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have pain in both my knees and severe pain over my right groin area. My right leg also seems a bit shortened and is bent, turned inward, and pulled toward my other leg.
Have you had any previous injuries or surgeries on your knees or groin area?
No, I have not had any previous injuries or surgeries on my knees or groin area.
Have you noticed any swelling or redness in your knees or groin area?
No, I haven't noticed any swelling or redness.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or activity level?
No, there haven't been any recent changes in my weight or activity level.
Have you had any family members with similar symptoms?
No, no family members have had similar symptoms.
Have you had any allergies or medical conditions in the past?
No, I haven't mentioned having any allergies or medical conditions in the past.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or lifestyle?
No, there haven't been any recent changes in my diet or lifestyle.
Have you had any recent stressful events or changes in your work or personal life?
I was involved in a rear-end collision recently.
Final Diagnosis: Knee Osteochondritis Dissecans (OCD)

There have been no recent changes in weight or activity level, and no family members have had similar symptoms. The patient also denies any allergies or medical conditions in the past, and there have been no recent changes in diet or lifestyle. The patient reports being involved in a recent rear-end collision.
